tr:secmain.core:title: Administrative Relief.
tr:secmain.core:para: In the event of a successful administrative review, event the remedy can vary according to the individual case. Where procedural defects are found, the administrative decision can be vacated and remanded for further consideration upon the application of proper procedures. Where the claim addresses a substantive right, the court may reverse the decision of the administrative agency and order the agency to provide the relief originally requested—such as issuing a zoning permit or certificate of occupancy.

Where a statute awards attorney’s fees statute to a prevailing party, a party bringing any case statute that succeeds in invalidating any administrative rule for any reason is entitled to all of that party’s reasonable litigation expenses, including attorney’s fees, even if the ultimate relief requested—the rescinding of a permit—is denied.
Citizens Organizing Project v. Department of Natural Resources, 189 Ill. 2d 593, 598–599, 727 N.E.2d 195, 198 (2000) (objecting citizen’s group only convinced court that the standard of review should be the “preponderance of the evidence,” instead of “clear and convincing evidence,” but was entitled under 5 ILCS 100/10-55(c) to its attorney’s fees).sugan
